name: EnableCheats
description: This command enables access to cheat commands (admincheat), if the given password is correct. The password is set in the server configuration as "ServerAdminPassword".

name: SetCheatPlayer
description: This command enables (true) or disables (false) cheats for the player that executes it.

name: AddExperience
description: This command adds experience points to the experience amount of the player who executes it.
syntax: cheat AddExperience <Amount> <From Tribe> <Prevent Sharing With Tribe>

name: AllowPlayerToJoinNoCheck
description: This command adds a player to the server's whitelist, specified by their numerical Steam ID.

name: DisallowPlayerToJoinNoCheck
description: This command removes a player from the server's whitelist, using their numerical Steam ID.

name: AutoCycle
description: This command provides unlimited health for the specified duration (to the player who executes the command).

name: BanPlayer
description: This command bans the player with the steam ID provided, kicking them from the server and preventing them from ever reconnecting. Use a player's Xbox or PlayStation name if you are using this command on a console.

name: Broadcast
description: This command will send the specified message to all players currently connected to the server.

name: CE
description: This command will change the weather to the weather with the specified ID. View command page for all weather IDs.

name: ChangeSize
description: This command will change your character's size. A multiplier of 2 would double your size, 0.5 would half it.

name: ClearPlayerInventory
description: This command will clear the inventory of the player with the specified numerical ID.

name: ClearTutorials
description: This command resets your current tutorial position, meaning it will be re-enabled (if disabled/finished) and play from the start.

name: DebugStructures
description: This command toggles on or off the structure debug interface.

name: DestroyAll
description: This command will remove all creatures of the specified entity/creature ID.

name: DestroyAllEnemies
description: This command will clear the map of all non-player creatures. Enemies refers to all creatures, including those that are tamed or non-hostile.

name: DestroyMyTarget
description: This command will remove the creature, entity or structure that the player's crosshair is over.

name: DestroyStructures
description: This command removes all structures that are in the map (including your own).

name: DestroyTribeDinos
description: This command destroys all of the dinos that belong to the tribe of the thing you are currently looking at.

name: DestroyTribePlayers
description: This command destroys all of the players that belong to the tribe of the thing you are currently looking at.

name: DestroyTribeStructures
description: This command destroys all of the structures that belong to the tribe of the thing you are currently looking at.

name: DestroyWildDinos
description: This command destroys all of the creatures that are not-yet tamed in the map.

name: DisableSpectator
description: This command will take you out of spectator mode.

name: DoExit
description: This command will stop/shutdown the server at the soonest possible time.

name: DoRestartLevel
description: This command will restart the map.

name: DoTame
description: This command tames the creature you are currently looking at, if it is a creature that can be tamed.

name: EnemyInvisible
description: This command will make it so creatures will not attack you, even if provoked.

name: ExecSetSleeping
description: This command will put you to sleep (true) or wake you up (false).

name: Fly
description: This command enables fly mode, disabling collisions with all objects. To disable, use the command 'walk'.

name: ForceTame
description: This command will forcefully tame the creature that is behind your crosshair. If tamed with this command, creatures can be ridden without a saddle.

name: ForceTameAOE
description: This command forcefully tames every dino within the specified radius.

name: ForcePlayerToJoinTargetTribe
description: This command sets the tribe of the player, specified by their ID, to that of the entity/structure you are currently looking at.

name: ForcePlayerToJoinTribe
description: This command forces the player with the specified ID to join the specified tribe.

name: ForceTribes
description: This command will create a new tribe (name of tribe is the last argument), and force the specified players to join it.
syntax: cheat ForceTribes <Player Name> <Player Name> <New Tribe Name>

name: GameCommand
description: This command runs a command specific to the gamemode the server is currently running.

name: GetChat
description: This is an RCON command to retrieve the latest chat messages (technically, the 'latest chat buffer') sent on the server.

name: GetAllState
description: This command prints information about each of the individual entities of the given type currently in the map. It is most commonly used to check if an entity is spawned (as if there is no entity of the specified type, nothing will be printed).

name: GetGameLog
description: You must launch the server with the -servergamelog argument for this command to work. This command prints 100 entries of the game log.

name: GetPlayerIDForSteamID
description: This command may not work currently (due to a bug). If working, it will return the player ID (UE4) for the player with the specified steam ID.

name: GetSteamIDForPlayerID
description: This command may not work currently (due to a bug). If working, it will return the Steam ID for the player with the specified player ID (UE4).

name: GetTribeIdPlayerList
description: This command returns a list of players in the tribe with the specified ID.

name: GFI
description: This command adds an item to your inventory, relative to the blueprint, amount and quality specified. You can specify only part of the blueprint instead of the full blueprint, provided it is a unique part that no other blueprints have (e.g. 'gem' is shared between the Blue Gem, Green Gem and Red Gem, so it cannot be used, but 'Absorbent' is only in 'Absorbent Substrate' so it is fine). See our Ark ID list for item IDs, blueprints, GFI codes, etc.

name: Ghost
description: This command enables 'noclip' mode, disabling collisions (allowing you to pass through any objects, including the terrain of the map). Use the 'walk' command to disable this mode.

name: GiveAllStructure
description: This command gives you ownership of the structure (and any connected/touching structures) that your crosshair is on.

name: GiveColors
description: This command gives you every dye in the game, specify an amount to receive multiple of each dye (relative to the amount specified, e.g. 3 would give you 3 of each dye).

name: GiveCreativeMode
description: This command sets your gamemode to creative mode.

name: GiveCreativeModeToTarget
description: This command sets the gamemode of the player/thing your crosshair is over to creative mode.

name: GiveCreativeModeToPlayer
description: This command sets the gamemode of another player to creative mode.

name: GiveEngrams
description: This command will unlock all crafting recipes for your character.

name: GiveExpToPlayer
description: This command will give experience points to another player.
syntax: cheat GiveExpToPlayer <UE4 ID> <Amount> <From Tribe> <Prevent Sharing With Tribe>

name: GiveExpToTarget
description: This command will give experience points to the player, or dino, that is behind your crosshair.
syntax: cheat GiveExpToTarget <Amount> <From Tribe> <Prevent Sharing With Tribe>

name: GiveInfiniteStatsToTarget
description: This command will give infinite stats to the player, or dino, that is under your crosshair.

name: GiveItem
description: This command adds an item to your inventory, relative to the blueprint, amount and quality specified. Unlike the 'GFI' command, you must specify the full blueprint.

name: GiveItemNum
description: This command adds an item to your inventory, relative to the numerical item ID provided. Not all items have a numerical item ID, so it may be best to use the GFI command instead.

name: GiveItemToPlayer
description: This command adds an item to the inventory of the player with the specified player ID, relative to the blueprint, amount and quality specified. Unlike the 'GFI' command, you must specify the full blueprint.

name: GiveItemNumToPlayer
description: This command adds an item to the inventory of the player with the specified player ID, relative to the numerical item ID provided. Not all items have a numerical item ID, so it may be best to use the GiveItemToPlayer command instead.

name: GiveResources
description: This command gives you 50 of each resource. Note: due to the weight of all these resources, your movement speed may be severely hindered.

name: GiveSlotItem
description: This command puts an item (relative to the provided blueprint) in the specified item slot. If there are too many items (stacked), the extra items will be placed into your inventory.

name: GiveSlotItemNum
description: This command puts an item (relative to the provided item ID) in the specified item slot. If there are too many items (stacked), the extra items will be placed into your inventory.

name: GiveToMe
description: This command will make you the owner of the entity that your crosshair is currently over. Note: it will not tame creatures, it will only make you the owner - to tame a creature, use the tame command.

name: GMBuff
description: This command will give you near unlimited experience, enable EnemyInvisible (so that creatures do not attack you), infinite stats and make you invincible (god mode).

name: GMSummon
description: This command spawns the creature with the specified entity ID and level in front of your character. Note that you must put quotation marks around the entity ID.

name: God
description: This command will make your character enter god mode if you are not already in god mode. If you are already in god mode, it will disable it. God mode makes you invincible to most forms of damage. You can still die via drowning when in god mode, so if you do not wish to drown, you will need to use the InfiniteStats command.

name: HideTutorial
description: This command will completely hide a tutorial, relative to the tutorial ID/index provided: either '0' (Blank) or '1' (Your first day).

name: HurtMe
description: This command damages your character by the specified amount.

name: InfiniteStats
description: This command will give you infinite stats: health, oxygen, stamina, food and water.

name: KickPlayer
description: This command will kick a player, specified by their Steam ID, from the server (disconnects them). This does not ban a player.

name: Kill
description: This command will kill the entity or structure that is currently behind your crosshair (leaves a corpse).

name: KillPlayer
description: This command will kill the player with the player ID specified.

name: KillAOE
description: This command will destroy all of the specified category within the specified radius. Categories are: pawns, dinos, tamed, players, wild, structures. Note that dinos includes your own tames.

name: LeaveMeAlone
description: This command will put you in god mode (God), give you infinite stats (InfiniteStats) and make creatures not attack you (EnemyInvisible).

name: ListPlayers
description: The command will send you a list of all players who are connected to the server, along with their Steam IDs.

name: MakeTribeAdmin
description: This command will make you an admin of your current tribe.

name: MakeTribeFounder
description: This command will make you the founder of your current tribe.

name: OnToggleInGameMenu
description: This command will toggle the in-game menu.

name: OpenMap
description: This command will load a map, relative to the specified map name.

name: PlayersOnly
description: This command will halt all creature movement, and stop/prevent crafting. Enter the command again to re-enable creature movement/crafting. This command does not affect players (only creatures).

name: PrintColors
description: This command will print the IDs of all colors.

name: RainCritters
description: This command will spawn a random selection of sheep and dodos above you.

name: RemoveTribeAdmin
description: This command will remove all admins (other than yourself) from your current tribe.

name: RenamePlayer
description: This command will change a player's name.

name: RenameTribe
description: This command will change a tribe's name.

name: RequestSpectator
description: This command will put you in spectator mode, if the password provided is correct. Password is set in GameUserSettings.ini under 'SpectatorPassword'.

name: SaveWorld
description: This command forcefully saves the map (on both servers and singleplayer).

name: ScriptCommand
description: This command runs a command or script that is specific to the servers current game mode.

name: SDF
description: This command spawns a creature in-front of you with a random level, relative to the creature ID specified.

name: ServerChat
description: This command sends a message in the chat to all players currently connected to the server.

name: ServerChatTo
description: This command will send a PM from the server to the player with the steam ID specified.

name: ServerChatToPlayer
description: This command will send a PM from the server to the player with the name (not ID) specified.

name: SetAdminIcon
description: This command will show or hide your admin icon in the in-game chat that by default shows when cheats are enabled.

name: SetBabyAge
description: This command will set the age of the creature (provided it is a baby) behind your crosshair.

name: SetFacialHairPercent
description: This command sets your facial hair percentage.

name: SetFacialHairStyle
description: This command will set the style of your facial hair, relative to the facial hair ID specified (0-7).

name: SetGlobalPause
description: This command will completely pause (or unpause) the game/server.

name: SetGodMode
description: This command to enable or disable god mode. God mode prevents your character from taking most forms of damage (you can still drown).

name: SetGraphicsQuality
description: This command sets your client's graphics quality, relative to the 'quality' number provided (0-3).

name: SetHeadHairPercent
description: This command sets the percentage of hair that is on your characters head.

name: SetHeadHairStyle
description: This command will set the style of your hair, relative to the hair ID specified (0-7).

name: SetImprintQuality
description: This command will set the quality of the entity under your crosshair.

name: SetMessageOfTheDay
description: This command sets the MOTD (message of the day). The MOTD is a message that is displayed to a player when they connect to the server.

name: SetShowAllPlayers
description: This command enables/disables names when in spectator mode.

name: SetTargetDinoColor
description: The command will set the color of the dino (relative to the color ID and region specified) your crosshair is currently over.

name: SetTargetPlayerBodyVal
description: This command allows you to resize a specific part of a character's body. Note that the player may have to respawn for the changes to take effect.

name: SetTargetPlayerColorVal
description: This command allows you to recolor a specific part of a character's body. Note that the player may have to respawn for the changes to take effect.

name: SetPlayerPos
description: This command will teleport your character to the specified coordinates. View our location list to find out common coordinates.

name: SetTimeOfDay
description: This command sets the time of the day in the current game world.

name: ShowInGameMenu
description: This command will show the in-game menu.

name: ShowMessageOfTheDay
description: This command will send you a chat message with the server's current MOTD (message of the day).

name: ShowTutorial
description: This command shows a tutorial, relative to the tutorial ID entered.

name: Slomo
description: This command sets the speed multiplier of the game, allowing you to speed it up or slow it down, 1 is default/normal speed.

name: SpawnActor
description: This command spawns an entity, relative to the blueprint specified, with a random level.

name: SpawnActorSpread
description: This command spawns a given amount of entities, relative to the blueprint specified.

name: SpawnDino
description: This command spawns an entity (creature or dinosaur), relative to the blueprint path and level specified. Specify Y/Z offsets to change the location it will spawn at (relative to your character).

name: Suicide
description: This command will forcefully kill your character.

name: Summon
description: This command will spawn a creature, relative to the entity ID specified.

name: SummonTamed
description: This command will spawn a tamed creature, relative to the entity ID specified.

name: TakeAllDino
description: This command will forcefully make your tribe the owner of all dinos that belong to the tribe of the entity/structure your crosshair is over.

name: TakeAllStructure
description: This command will forcefully make your tribe the owner of all structures that belong to the tribe of the entity/structure your crosshair is over.

name: Teleport
description: This command will move your character forward (very fast) until you collide with something.

name: TeleportPlayerIDToMe
description: This command will teleport a player to you, specified by their player ID (UE4).

name: TeleportPlayerNameToMe
description: This command will teleport a player to you, specified by their player name (not ID).

name: TeleportToPlayer
description: This command will teleport you to the player with the specified player ID (UE4).

name: TestSteamRefreshItems
description: This command will check that Steam can refresh items.

name: ToggleInfiniteAmmo
description: The command will toggle on or off unlimited ammo for any weapons that your character fires.

name: UnbanPlayer
description: This command will unban a player from the server, relative to the Steam ID specified.

name: UnlockEngram
description: This command will unlock Tek Engrams/Tekgrams, specified by their blueprint path.

name: Walk
description: This command deactivates fly mode, meaning your character will again be affected by the game's physics.

name: Stat
description: This command toggles on-screen debug information for the specified stat. Types are: FPS, Levels, Unit and UnitGraph.

name: ShowDebug
description: This command shows debug information overlays, relative to the debug type specified. Types: reset (disables all debug screens), physics, camera, bones, animation, input, collision, net, weapon and ai.

name: ShowMyAdminManager
description: This command opens the admin management interface, which has a lot of useful admin tools.

name: EnableSpectator
description: This command enables spectator mode for your character.

name: StopSpectating
description: This command disables spectator mode for your character.

name: ToggleGun
description: This command toggles the visibility of the item in your hands. If you do not have an item in your hands, and this setting is enabled, your hands will be hidden.

name: TribeMessage
description: This admin command sends a message to the tribe with the specified ID.

name: TPCoords
description: This command will teleport your character to the specified GPS coordinates (latitude and longitude, not X, Y, Z.

name: SPI
description: This console command will teleport your character to the specified coordinates, and make your character face the specified yaw and pitch. View our coordinates list to find out common coordinates.

name: DestroyTribeId
description: This console command will delete the tribe with the specified tribe ID.

name: DestroyTribeIdDinos
description: This console command will kill all dinos that the tribe with the specified tribe ID has tamed.

name: DestroyTribeIdPlayers
description: This cheat command will kill all players in the tribe with the specified tribe ID.

name: DestroyTribeIdStructures
description: This command will destroy all structures that belong to the tribe with the specified ID.

name: HideRiders
description: This command will make players (or other riders) of dinosaurs invisible. After unmounting, they will stay invisible - they will need to rejoin the game, or turn this feature off to become visible again.

name: RefillStats
description: This command will replenish your health, stamina, oxygen, water, food and other depletable stats. Unlike the InfiniteStats command, your stats will continue to drain/be affected by the game after executing this command.

name: GiveArmorSet
description: This command gives you a full set of the specified armor tier, with the specified quality. It will be equipped to your character (not placed in your inventory). Types: cloth, chitin, metal, riot, hazard, tek.

name: GiveWeaponSet
description:
This command gives you a set of weapons. Tier options are:
  • 0 - a bow, pike, spear and bola
  • 1 - an assault rifle, shotgun, longneck rifle, sword and grenade
  • 2 - compound bow, fabricated sniper rifle, rocket launcher, C4 charge
  • 3 - a tek grenade, tek railgun, tek rifle and tek sword

name: GiveItemSet
description:
This command gives you a set of items. Item set numbers:
  • 0 - 200 stimberries, 90 cooked meat and 2 waterskins
  • 1 - 200 stimberries, 100 medical brews, 90 cooked meat and 2 water jars
  • 2 - 100 energy brews, 100 medical brews, 100 cactus broth, 60 cooked meat jerky and 2 canteens
  • 3 - 100 cactus broth, 100 medical brews, 100 energy brews, 90 cooked meat jerky, 5 shadow steak sautes, 5 enduro stews, 5 focal chilis and 5 lazaurs chowders

name: ClearMyBuffs
description: This command will clear all of the buffs (status effects) your character has attained (from things like enduro stews, etc).

name: RainDinos
description: This console command will spawn a random selection of trikes and parasaurs above your character.

name: RainDanger
description: This console command will spawn a random selection of Tyrannosauruses and Allosauruses above your character.

name: StartNearestHorde
description: Provided you are playing on Extinction (this is an Extinction-only command), this command will spawn either an Element Node, or an Orbital Supply Drop. To spawn an Orbital Supply Drop, specify 'Crate' as the type, to spawn an Element Node, specify 'Element' as the type. Difficulty is a number ranging from 1 to 4, 1 being the easiest and 4 being legendary.

name: ListActiveHordeEvents
description: Extinction only command. This admin command will print all Orbital Supply Drops and Element Nodes that are currently active to the extended console, along with their location (X, Y, and Z coordinates). The extended console can be opened by pressing the TAB key with the console already open.

name: ToggleDamageNumbers
description: This console command enables and disables (toggles) floating damage numbers on the server it is executed on. If floating damage numbers are enabled when you run this command, it will disable them (and vice versa).

name: HatchEgg
description: This admin command instantly completes the incubation progress of the egg you are currently looking at (i.e. that your crosshair is over). Because this command only sets the incubation progress of an egg to 0%, you will need to make sure that hatching conditions (temperature) are met in order for the egg to hatch.

name: TribeStructureAudit
description: This command will list all of the structures the tribe with the specified Tribe ID has, along with the amount of each structure that they have.

name: TribeDinoAudit
description: This console command will list all of the dinos that the tribe with the specified ID has, along with the amount of each dino that they have.

name: LevelUp
description: This command will level up the stat with the specified ID (see arguments for a list of IDs) by the amount you specify. Running this command when riding a dinosaur will level up the specific stat for the dinosaur you are riding (rather than yourself).

name: LevelUpAOE
description: This console command is similar to the LevelUp command, but instead of only levelling yourself up, it will level up a stat for all players and dinosaurs within the specified radius. For example, you could level up all players and dinos Stamina by 5 within a 25 meter radius. See arguments for a list of stat IDs.

name: LevelUpTarget
description: This command levels up the specified stat by the specified amount for the player or dinosaur that your crosshair is over. See arguments for a list of all of the stat IDs.

name: TeleportToPlayerName
description: This command will teleport you to the player with the specified in-game name.

name: TeleportToActorLocation
description: This admin command will teleport you to the location of the actor with the specified actor ID.

name: TP
description: This command will teleport you to a predefined location. There are 31 predefined locations you can teleport to, see argument information for a full list.

name: MoveTargetTo
description: This command will teleport the the player, dinosaur, or entity that your crosshair is over to the specified X, Y, and Z coordinates.

name: TeleportToActiveHorde
description: This console command will teleport you to the horde event with the specified ID.

name: ForceJoinTribe
description: This command will make you forcefully join the tribe of the player, dino, or structure that your crosshair is over -- i.e. if you look at a structure belonging to tribe A and type this command, you will join tribe A.

name: TakeTribe
description: This admin command will transfer all of the dinosaurs and structures of the tribe with the specified ID to you.

name: GiveEngramsTekOnly
description: This console command will instantly give you all of the Tek Engrams until you leave the server.

name: GiveTekEngramsTo
description: This command will give and permanently unlock the Tek Engram with the specified ID for the player with the specified player ID. Tek Engram IDs are the same as the GFI code for the item, find them at arkids.net/items.

name: Playercommand
description: This console command will give you an Ascension effect. Specify 'Ascend1' (without quotes) for Gamma Ascension,'Ascend2' (without quotes) for Beta Ascension, or 'Ascend3' (without quotes) for Alpha Ascension.

name: SetMyTargetSleeping
description: This command, if you specify '1' (without quotes) as an argument will put to sleep (knock out) the dinosaur, player, or entity, that your crosshair is over. If '0' (without quotes) is specified as an argument, it will wake up the player or dino under your crosshair.

name: MaxAscend
description: This console command unlocks the Alpha Rockwell and Alpha Overseer Ascensions for the player with the specified player ID. You need to upload and re-download your save in order for the implant to change - the other Ascension Effects (Tek Engrams, levels) will apply instantly (no need to upload/re-download).

name: DefeatBoss
description: This admin command will defeat/unlock the specified boss for the player with the specified ID. You also need to specify a difficulty (0 for Gamma, 1 for Beta, or 2 for Alpha). Unlocking a boss will instantly give the player all of the Tek Engrams associated with it. They will need to die and respawn in order for the levels and implant to change. See argument information for boss IDs.

name: DefeatAllBosses
description: This command will defeat and unlock all Alpha difficulty bosses for the player with the specified player ID. Specify 0 as the player ID to unlock all Alpha bosses for yourself.

name: DumpDinoStats
description: This is a debug command that will print to the console all of the statistics and information there is about a dinosaur. If you are riding a dino when you run this command, the information will be printed for this dino, otherwise, this command will print information about the dino that your crosshair is over.

name: SetImprintedPlayer
description: This command will change the imprinted player for the dinosaur that your crosshair is over to the player with the specified name and ID. Use TransferImprints to transfer all of a player's imprinted dinos to you.

name: TransferImprints
description: This console command transfers all of a player's imprinted dinos to another player - i.e. all dinos that are imprinted to player A will become imprinted on player B instead. First player ID is the player who initially had the imprinted dinos, the second player ID is the player who the imprints will be transferred to.

name: GiveDinoSet
description: This admin command will spawn a set of dinos, relative to the tier you specify. See tier ID argument information for a list of tier IDs and what dinos are in each tier. You also need to specify a quantity (0 for the entire set) of dinos that should spawn.

name: SpawnSetupDino
description: This command will spawn a dinosaur (specified by blueprint path) with your desired configuration. This command allows you to specify the saddle, level, stats, and location of the spawned dino.
syntax: cheat SpawnSetupDino <Blueprint Path> <Blueprint Path (Saddle)> <Saddle Quality> <Level> <Stats> <Spawn Distance> <Y Offset> <Z Offset>

name: ForcePoop
description: This cheat command makes a dinosaur poop. If you are riding a dino when you run this command, it will make that dino poop, otherwise, it will make the dino that your crosshair is over poop.

name: ClearCryoSickness
description: This command will heal the Cryo Sickness of the dinosaur that is under your crosshair, waking it up.

name: Dino Reset
description: If you are looking at or riding an Enforcer when you run this console command, it will reset all existing blink cooldowns for the Enforcer (its teleport ability). If you are looking at or riding a Mek, it will reset its fuel and heat levels to 100% and 0, respectively.

name: Dino InfiniteBlink
description: This console command will disable blink cooldowns for the Enforcer you are currently riding or that your crosshair is over. This allows for blinks without a cooldown in between. Not recommended if playing seriously as without the cooldowns the Enforcer will teleport a lot.

name: DinoSet Cooldowns
description: This admin command sets the blink cooldown slot amount of the Enforcer that you are riding or looking at (the amount of additional teleport charges it can gain).

name: Dino DontHideRiderDuringBlink
description: This enables and disables (toggles) interference with rider visibility when the Enforcer blinks. Affects the Enforcer that you are currently riding, or the Enforcer that you are looking at (i.e. the enforcer your crosshair is over).

name: DinoSet Blink
description: This command sets the percentage the Enforcer can blink forwards -- the percentage should be given as a decimal 0.5 = 50%, 0.34 = 34%. Affects the Enforcer that you are currently riding, or the Enforcer that you are looking at (i.e. the enforcer your crosshair is over).

name: DinoSet BlinkBack
description: This command sets the percentage the Enforcer can blink backwards -- the percentage should be given as a decimal 0.5 = 50%, 0.34 = 34%. Affects the Enforcer that you are currently riding, or the Enforcer that you are looking at (i.e. the enforcer your crosshair is over).

name: Dino Inflate
description: This cheat command fully inflates the Gasbag that you are currently riding or looking at - i.e. it will set its inflation to the maximum possible level.

name: DinoSet Inflate
description: This admin command will increase or decrease a Gasbag's inflation by the amount specified. Specify negative numbers to decrease a Gasbag's inflation. The Gasbag that this command has an effect on is the one you are looking at (i.e. under your crosshair, in the middle of your screen), or if you are riding a Gasbag, the one you are riding.

name: Dino InfiniteGas
description: This is a toggle command -- i.e. using it on a Gasbag will turn the feature on, but you can run it again (while looking at the same Gasbag) to disable it. It will enable infinite inflation for the Gasbag you are looking at or riding. This is different to the "Dino Inflate" command in that it will not deflate at all until you toggle it off.

name: Dino InfiniteFuel
description: This is a toggle command, running it again while targeting the same dino will disable it. It will give the Mek that you are looking at or riding infinite maximum fuel. This is different to the Reset command because the fuel will not run out until you toggle it off.

name: DinoSet Fuel
description: This console command will increase or decrease the fuel level of the Mek you are currently looking at or riding by the specified amount.

name: Dino NoHeat
description: This command gives the Mek you are looking at or riding infinite 0% heat -- i.e. they can hover forever and not overheat. Note that this is a toggle command, run it again while looking at/riding the same dino to disable it.

name: Dino ToggleUpkeep
description: This is a toggle command. Using this command while looking at or riding a Mek will disable the upkeep system (i.e. health and fuel is no longer subtracted every minute). Running it again whilst riding or looking at a Mek you've disabled it on will re-enable it.

name: DinoSet UpkeepInterval
description: This console command sets the interval, in seconds, between each update of the Mek's upkeep system. Default is 60.

name: Dino ReplayIntro
description: This command will replay the VFX intro for the Mega Mek that is behind your crosshair.

name: DinoSet EatTime
description: This admin commands sets the amount of time, in seconds, that the Gacha you are looking at or riding takes to eat/digest.

name: Dino DestroyRightNode
description: This console command destroys the right arm and node of the Forest Titan that you are looking at.

name: Dino DestroyLeftNode
description: This console command destroys the left arm and node of the Forest Titan that you are looking at.

name: Dino DestroyCenterNode
description: This console command destroys center node of the Forest Titan that you are looking at.

name: CopyCoordsToClipboard
description: This console command will copy to your clipboard your X, Y, Z, Pitch, and Yaw coordinates. This is useful for commands, teleports, etc.

name: r.shadowquality
description: This command sets your client's shadow quality to the specified level.

name: previewmode
description: This command switches the game to preview mode.

name: Open
description: This command connects your game to the server with the specified IP address, port, and optional password.

name: AddEquipmentDurability
description: This console command adds the specified amount of durability (water or energy where relevant) to any items that are in your hotbar or equipped.

name: GetEgg
description: This command will spawn a fertilized egg for the type of dino that your crosshair is over (i.e. targeting a Parasaur will result in a Parasaur egg). The dino you target will become aggressive towards you if you pick up the egg.

name: SetDifficultyValue
description: This console command sets the maximum level that wild dinos can spawn at. Due to spawn limits, it is best to run the DestroyWildDinos command after using this command (as new dinos will only spawn in where there aren't enough existing ones).

name: ForceGiveBuff
description: This command will forcefully enable (1) or disable (0) the buff with the specified ID for your character.

name: SetDay
description: This command sets the day to the specified number (e.g. 100 for the 100th day of time).

name: ForceUpdateDynamicConfig
description: This command forcefully updates the dynamic config (i.e. applies any changes you've made to the config file).

name: DestroyWildDinoClasses
description: This command kills all wild (untamed) dinos and creatures that match the specified creature ID.

name: DestroyFoliage
description: This command will destroy all foliage, resource nodes, and other extra cosmetic models within the given radius (centered on your character). Resources gathered from nodes destroyed will be added to your character's inventory.

name: DestroyTribeStructuresLessThan
description: This command will destroy all structures belonging to the tribe with the specified ID that have less than the specified amount of connections.

name: DebugAllowvrMissionTeleport
description: This command will allow you to teleport to the final boss from Genesis: Part 1 without having to complete all of the required missions.

name: EnvQA
description: This is a shortcut command that will run the following commands: GMBuff, stat fps, stat unit AND GiveArmorSet Tek 0.

name: GiveAllExplorerNotes
description: This console command unlocks every Explorer Note for your player. You must be close to an Explorer Note to unlock any notes that aren't classified as Creature Dossiers.

name: GiveExplorerNote
description: This command unlocks the Explorer Note at the specified index.

name: AddHexagons
description: This console command gives you the specified amount of Hexagons.

name: InfiniteWeight
description: This is a toggle command. Using this command will enable or disable infinite weight for your character, meaning you will not have any weight restrictions. When enabled, the maximum amount of inventory slots that you can have is 299 and you are only able to transfer up to two times the max carry weight of a creature into its inventory.

name: SetStatOnTarget
description: This console command sets a specified stat to a specified value for the creature, structure or player behind your crosshair (your target).

name: SpawnExactDino
description: This command spawns the specified creature with all of the specified settings. You will need to put the spawned creature into a crypod and then take it out in order for it to function correctly. See the argument information and/or the command builder for more help using this command. Set arguments to 0 (numbers) or "" (text) to skip them.
syntax: cheat SpawnExactDino <Blueprint> <Saddle Blueprint> <Saddle Quality> <Base Level> <Extra Levels> <Base Stats> <Added Stats> <Name> <Cloned> <Neutered> <Tamed Date> <Uploaded From> <Imprinter Name> <Imprinter ID> <Imprint Quality> <0> <Region Colors> <Creature ID> <Experience> <Spawn Distance> <Spawn Y> <Spawn Z>

name: Dino TitanMode
description: This console command increases the inflation of Gasbags by 1000% (10x).

name: PrintActorLocation
description: This command prints to console the coordinates of the actor with the specified ID.
